data.title: Cottage and Barn Rentals at Beach Plum Farm
data.meta_description: A stay at the cottages is perfect for a gathering of family and friends, holiday celebrations, a family reunion, a special birthday celebration or just a much-needed retreat with the ones you love. Enjoy the simple pleasures of a dip in the Orchard pool.
data.text:
Six Farm Barns & Cottages

Nestled by the Sea

Tucked away in West Cape May on 62 acres of open farmland, the Beach Plum Farm Cottages offer a fresh alternative to the classic Cape May beach vacation. They're a chance to experience our town by the sea from a different perspective, one steeped in the rich farming heritage and pastoral beauty of the Garden State. A range of accommodations make our cottages perfect for gatherings of family and friends, holiday celebrations, family reunions, special celebrations and much-needed retreats with the ones you love.

Beach Plum Farm was recently honored as a 2024 Oprah Daily O-Awards Winner in the "Eating as a Sacred Act" category. Oprah Daily presents this award to those "that can transform, teach, and serve as catalysts for becoming, in the words of Oprah herself, "the person you were always meant to be.”

- Oprah Daily

Learn More

A farm at your fingertips

Imagine a farm destination brimming with life and natural beauty. A place where you can participate in the egg, strawberry or tomato harvests as much or as little as you'd like. Where you can leave your car and be given keys to a golf cart and bicycles. Where you can sip coffee in your private garden, and swim in a pool set in an orchard. Where you can wind down the evening around a campfire, enjoying the night sounds echoing off the trees.

So was the vision of Curtis Bashaw and his partner Will Riccio, who acquired the land that is now Beach Plum Farm in 2007. As the years have passed, Beach Plum Farm has become much more than land that grows food—it has become a destination visitors who wish to participate in the rhythms of farm life.

Fall Migration with Richard Crossley

Available Monday, September 30 through Thursday, October 10, 2024

Each autumn, hundreds of species of birds take flight over Cape May as they head south for the winter—and with Richard Crossley as your guide, you'll experience the migration at its most spectacular.

“The largest variety of birds are moving south to their wintering grounds," Richard says. "We get everything: 30 species of warbler, shorebirds, raptors—you name it. It’s possible to see nearly 200 species over just a few days."

Richard Crossley is an internationally acclaimed birder, photographer and award winning author of ‘The Crossley ID Guide’ series. Crazy, wildly passionate, driven and single-minded are just a few of the words used to describe his love of birding and the outdoors.

Adventure Dinners on Tuesday and Wednesday evenings, each featuring a different location around Cape May's fields and coastlines. These special open air pop-up dinners are served family-style at a communal table, and each features a delicious farm-to-table dinner menu tailored to the evening

Surfing Lessons at The Beach Shack

Available Saturdays from September 6 through October 28, 2024

Learn to ride the waves in Cape May with an expertly-led surfing lesson! This experience is available as a Stay Enhancement for stays at the Beach Plum Farm Cottages.

Join Cape May’s vibrant surfing culture for a weekend, where you’ll be treated to a customized surfing lesson in the waters of Cove Beach. Take to the water with instructors from our partners at EcoVentures, who will teach you how to ride the waves at your own pace and comfort level. Our sister property, the Beach Shack, will serve as the base camp for this exciting experience.

This experience can be added to your overnight stay at the Beach Plum Farm Cottages as a Stay Enhancement.

This experience is family-friendly! Anyone age 8+ who is able to swim can take the surfing lesson.

Sweet Amalia Oyster Getaway

Available for Stays this September and October

Experience the world of oyster farming firsthand with a deluxe getaway in Cape May that pairs hard work with fine tastes.

“It’s a gritty, dirty, muddy job, and perhaps you have to be just a little bit crazy to do it. But there’s also a romance to this work," says Lisa Calvo, owner of Sweet Amalia Oyster Farm.

For three decades, most recently with Rutgers University, Lisa studied shellfish pathology, helping to develop oysters resistant to disease. As a side hustle, she launched Sweet Amalia, which was named for her daughter, who, as a toddler, would slurp oysters straight off the reef. The project began as a learning laboratory for studying aquaculture so that Calvo might better assist other farmers, but, a couple of years ago, it became her full-time occupation. Now, on a six-acre, intertidal plot located off of Route 47, Calvo and her team harvest approximately 3,000 oysters per season.

Experience the world of oyster farming firsthand with a deluxe getaway in Cape May that pairs hard work with fine tastes. On the storied banks of the Delaware Bay, you'll receive a shucking lesson and an oyster tasting led by Sweet Amalia's experienced oyster farmers. And, to round out your stay in Cape May, you'll enjoy a world-class dinner in the Ebbitt Room that incorporates tide-to-table oyster recipes from Chef Jason Hanin.

Included in your stay:

The Holiday Home

Available Friday, November 8 through Tuesday, December 10, 2024

A guided candle and wreath-making décor experience, immersed in the holiday magic of our farm.

Beautiful décor is at the heart of Beach Plum Farm’s holiday magic. Each year, we change up the presentation a bit for our Holiday Farm-to-Table Dinner series, mixing twinkle lights and thoughtful touches with treasures foraged from our fields. From visuals like the greenery overhead to the taper candles on the table; each detail is considered! We love hosting these special dinners, creating a seasonal spectacle both elevated and intimate, filled with scenes that surprise and delight. And now, for the first time, we’re excited to offer a series of seminars that will immerse you in a spirit of holiday creativity. Spend a long weekend at Beach Plum Farm, where we’ll treat you to a day filled with guided candle-making, wreath-making, and table-scaping. At the end of the day, you’ll have a suite of merriment to take home with you: a custom candle, a beautiful holiday wreath, and new insights on how to create your perfect holiday home.

Included in this package:

A guided candle-making session at Pour Candle Bar + Chandlery in West Cape May, where you'll create a custom candle with over 50 fragrances to choose from

A Wreath-Making and Table-Scaping Session at Beach Plum Farm, led by our experienced Farm and Event Décor teams/li>

A farm-fresh lunch on Monday afternoon

Breakfast each morning, delivered to your cottage

Our Holiday Home package includes a medium-sized custom candle in a metallic tin, valued at $15. Guests are welcome to upgrade their candle size for additional charge during their candle-making experience.

Family Gatherings & Reunions

Available Year Round

Relax and reconnect with the ones you love during a family reunion at Beach Plum Farm. Reunion packages are available for any number of cottages so families may enjoy time together with an exclusive experience at the farm. Our farm team and concierge will work with you to curate the perfect getaway, with something for guests of all ages. Join the agricultural team for seasonal harvesting, head to Davey’s Lake for a hike with one of our expert tour guides, bike to town for shopping and sightseeing, or spend a day at the beach. At the end of the day, gather around the table together with farm-fresh cocktails for an unforgettable meal followed by s’mores roasted over an open fire.
